content:
Tomorrow (Sept 1) is Feature Freeze. What are the features we're still trying to get in (if any)?
What can I help with?

I'm guessing these: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+milestone%3A1.17.0

backdrop/backdrop-issues
Issue tracker for Backdrop core. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop-issues development by creating an account on GitHub.
Password constraints issue may be close. I think it needs more eyes on it. #-4265
Oh, Lazy Loading is RTBC.

@BWPanda - I think that sandboxes are usually update automatically with a new commit, aren't they?
Maybe it depends upon the nature of the changes. I don't usually do anything manual to update sandboxes after I push new code (I'm usually pushing pretty simple code).

I suppose it would be different if the change does anything during install process.
Yeah, I'm not actually sure. I just assumed that was the case, but I guess it wouldn't make much sense to have to refresh the sandbox manually after each commit...

Maybe it's already too late, but we could get webp support in. But no need to rush, 1.18 is fine, too.

Add webp support · Issue #4509 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need A common "Opportunity" listed in Google PageSpeed insights is to "Serve images in next-gen formats." Backdrop does not currently support any next-gen for...
@indigoxela it could probably be 1.16.3 too

https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4558
https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4265

These are the two issues I'm watching closely today to see if they might still get into 1.17.0. Both could use some eyes on them today.

[UX] Allow *all* blocks to have an admin label · Issue #4558 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need If you create a custom block in a layout, but you don't want it to be reusable, there's no way to give that block an admin label that's not displayed on the fron...
[SR] Enforce some basic password constraints: no username, no email · Issue #4265 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need Currently Backdrop (and D7) allow anything to be entered in the password. I think that's okay for the most part (contrib modules like Password Policy (d7-only?) can prov...

I would like to get this small change in if possible please: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4584

Add a [node:author:link] token · Issue #4584 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
This is basically the same as the following Token 7.x issues: https://www.drupal.org/project/token/issues/1176592 I'm working on D7 Submitted By module and found that there is no way to have a ...
...just 6 lines of code :wink:
@klonos - I gave it the milestone candidate tag. Not sure I feel comfortable marking it RTBC, despite how simple the code looks.
To be added to the milestone, I think it either needs an advocate or to be RTBC.
Thanks @StPaulTim ++
stpaultim go team. (Karma: 24)
@jenlampton ?? perhaps you can have a look (pweeeese :smile: )

@StPaulTim recheck on https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4558 please?

[UX] Allow *all* blocks to have an admin label · Issue #4558 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need If you create a custom block in a layout, but you don't want it to be reusable, there's no way to give that block an admin label that's not displayed on the fron...
Also needs a milestone label. :smile:
It already has a label @docwilmot ...just not a milestone set.
...I'm testing/reviewing now.
RTBC @docwilmot :+1: ...we can tweak further in the next couple of weeks if needed.
@docwilmot ++
docwilmot leveled up! (Karma: 9)
...I've run out of juice for now (I should be working). GTG
@quicksketch I was pushing up tests while you were typing you needed tests. :smile:
Now it'll just look like you're really, really fast @docwilmot :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:
:rocket:

@jenlampton Can you give the thumbs-up to my fixing the tests in https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/706?

Use .htaccess for securing config directory · Issue #706 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Currently, the config directory is 'secured' by appending a hash string to the dir path. This has caused some issues when changing database credentials, etc., and could be improved. I sugge...
sure, running more tests now...
@jenlampton I am still around. Will test now.
@StPaulTim reject weak seems to be not working... but if you could test min length on it's own that would be great :) I'll push an update when you are done (don't want to break your sandbox)
ok
@jenlampton yes, min length seems to work
ok, pushing this change.
@jenlampton - Seems to be working for me.
I've got 2 tests failing locally - though not in Zen. trying to figure out why
bingo
I wonder if we have enough agreement on Password issue?

@StPaulTim looks like no: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4265

[SR] Enforce some basic password constraints: no username, no email · Issue #4265 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need Currently Backdrop (and D7) allow anything to be entered in the password. I think that's okay for the most part (contrib modules like Password Policy (d7-only?) can prov...
Makes sense to me
To put this off until later.
off to bed now sorry. good luck with the rest.
@StPaulTim are you still here?
@jenlampton how can I help you?

We both mentioned that we thought this might be close enough without the password length bit... so I'm seeing what that might look like here: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/pull/3282

4265 password policy simple by jenlampton · Pull Request #3282 · backdrop/backdrop
trying a simpler approach
it may be too late for this today so if you have other rhings to do it's not urgent
I'll take a look.
@jenlampton - The indicator doesn't seem to be visible in your last PR.
nevermind, it is working
@StPaulTim I fixed it. Let's get this one in, we're all on the same page
OK, I'm good with this one if you are satisfied with it and still have the possibility to move forward with your ideas in the future (after further discussion).
@Herb I think @jenlampton took a dinner break and will be back soon.
I'm going to bed
@jenlampton - Do we still have a core committer around to look at it?
@BWPanda - What do you think?
Are there other features still being worked on tonight?
@StPaulTim Are you referring to the password issue? If so, can you please summarise the current status for me to catch me up...?
Yes. 1 minute

@jenlampton submitted a revised PR that pulled out the minimum character enforcement. @Herb made a small revision and marked it RTBC. It's a VERY simple version of what had been discussed as recently as 3 days ago.
@quicksketch has offered to take a look at it again if @herbdool is in favor
@StPaulTim I'm seeing 2 failing tests... working on them locally now
passwords444359.png
OK.
Let @quicksketch take a look then. I haven't been following that issue much sorry.
No worries. Are you still working on any issues for 1.17 or is the Password Policy issue the last one

@quicksketch can merge https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/2162 and https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/3846 if possible. I don't feel I should since I was the one who marked them RTBC.

[UX] Change `Front page` to `Home page` in core · Issue #2162 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
We have a lot of places in core that refer to the home page of the site as a Front page. This is a bit of a drupalism and I would love to see us move to calling it the Home page consistently. That,...
[UX][DX] Update.php throws error about install.php (and says to delete live config) · Issue #3846 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
I'm experiencing some server issue (missing staging directory) that is preventing update.php from running. When this happens, I would expect to see an error message letting me know that my stag...

And https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/3595 looks like it might be good to go, but I haven't looked at it.

[UX] Add a summary text next to the CKEditor formatting options link, showing the active format · Issue #3595 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Follow-up to #3516 Original issue title: Add summary text for the fieldset that allows selecting a text editor In #3516 we changed the text size and appearance of the Formatting options link below ...
They're not specifically 1.17.0 issues, but they're all RTBC.

https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/3594 is the only 1.17.0 issue left

[D8] Expand image tokens to allow image styles (imagecache_token functionality) · Issue #3594 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need The functionality of Imagecache Token could be merged into the existing token functionality. (It looks like this functionality is merged into token in D8.) This module provi...
tests fixed :) string change...
giddy
All this time I thought we were approaching a 'code freeze', but it's only a 'feature freeze'. I'll try to lower my heart rate now.
(deleted)
Wrong chat channel

Hey folks, we cleared out the 1.17.0 milestone! Big thanks to super-reviewers @BWPanda, @Herb, @jenlampton, @StPaulTim, @docwilmot, @indigoxela, @klonos, @Laryn, and others I've probably missed! We can tidy up the 1.16.x and bug-fix queue a bit more before release. I'll be making a 1.17.0-preview release tomorrow.

I really wanted to get https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4584 in 1.17.0 :disappointed:

Add a [node:author:link] token · Issue #4584 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
This is basically the same as the following Token 7.x issues: https://www.drupal.org/project/token/issues/1176592 I'm working on D7 Submitted By module and found that there is no way to have a ...
Doh, sorry @klonos! Alas maybe it'll be a very early 1.18.0 feature.
...we were all saying that 1.17.0 was gonna be "slim" but ended up with 11 feature issues closed in that milestone :smile: ...plus another couple of tasks, and a couple of bug fixes!
...if you add the 49 closed issues in 1.16.3, that's a hell of a release. Great teamwork all!

For statistics-lovers: 49 closed Issues raise 1.16.3 to be the second in ranks regarding Issue count. Right after 1.0.0 (109 Issues), followed by 1.5.0 (48 Issues). :astonished:

backdrop/backdrop-issues
Issue tracker for Backdrop core. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop-issues development by creating an account on GitHub.
Yikes, we have a regression... CKEditor is broken on node forms that also have image fields.
@StPaulTim I wouldn't call it very simple. It's only got one thing less than my pr :wink:

For statistics-lovers: 49 closed Issues raise 1.16.3 to be the second in ranks regarding Issue count. Right after 1.0.0 (109 Issues), followed by 1.5.0 (48 Issues).

We still have two weeks to get issues into 1.16.3.
@Herb - I understand! The small problem I had with your recent PR was totally fixable. Thanks for all your work on this issue. I hope we continue the work.
@indigoxela did you open a 1.16.3 issue about the regression already? checking

yep, found it :) https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4592

Regression: CKEditor broken after #4527 · Issue #4592 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the bug On nodes with CKEditor enabled fields and image fields the editor is broken. js error: Uncaught TypeError: Backdrop.editors is undefined The problem seems to be the order of ...

I've created a checklist for the preview release today: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4593 @BWPanda @Herb @Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) please let me know if you are interested in taking on any of the release tasks! I have assigned them all to @quicksketch for now, but that can be changed :)

Backdrop 1.17.0-preview Release checklist · Issue #4593 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Scheduled for September 2nd, 2020 Pre-release tasks Merge commits Create a new minor release milestone Move all unfinished issues to the next minor release milestone Draft Release notes @jenlampton...

@StPaulTim @klonos I have assigned you two the blog post / roadmap updates / tweet stuff, but if anyone else is interested doing any of those things we love to share the love (and, responsibilities!) Also, if anyone else would like to do release notes, I'm happy give that up :)
I can certainly do the roadmap updates ...possibly the blog post about the 1.17.0 release too.
We never got a video done for 1.16. Maybe I can work on a combined video for 1.16 and 1.17?
Now that custom contexts is in do we need an issue to explain what the hell it means? I get the impression many people still don't get it.
I think we do. But, I didn't want to say anything that might slow things down, until it was committed.
I plan to look at it again in the next day or two and see if it makes more sense to me now.
@jenlampton thanks for all the work on this release. I wasn't available today
I wasn't available much today either, I only really made the release issues :) thank you @quicksketch @klonos and @StPaulTim !
Feature freeze for 1.18.0 today, yes?
Yes, that is the plan (at least my firm understanding of the plan)
I think that (in theory) we have time only till midnight today PT.
But, to be clear. The deadline today is ONLY for new features. UX changes and bug fixes can still be added through Jan 15th, right?
My understanding is that anything with the milestone 1.17.5 can be added through release date. Issues with the milestone 1.18 need to be ready today.
You are right @StPaulTim ...and if certain things can be split off from the main feature request as a clean-up "task", then the main feature can get in.
Oh, thats today?
I dont think relationships will get in then.

Yeah, I'm also struggling between work/life and finding time to polish the merging of the updates pages :sweat: ...perhaps I can trim down the changes and file a follow-up issue for the issue with the dashboard block, and then we might be able to still get it in.
Small PRs are good PRs :wink:

Yeah, I don't think the merged updates page or layout relationships would be a good idea to rush through at this point. If ya'll feel strongly about it we could probably merge and tidy over the next two weeks. But I don't think we need to create the pressure.
But correct, we have... about 7 hours left :sweat_smile: I was going to make the preview release today, but that could wait until tomorrow.
If we pushed the RC for another day, then that would help my issue a lot. I'm 99% there to solving this UX issue that dates since 2017, and I would really love to get it in for 1.18.0.

...what remains to be done is:

  1. remove the code changes related to the dashboard block (and leave that as a follow-up task, to be done in the next couple of weeks)
  2. confirm if the "lingering" menu items issue was actually related to https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4844 which has now been merged :smile:
Fix layout and views menu items get undeletable but stay visible once created · Issue #4844 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Problem When creating a menu item through a layout "menu settings" on a single URL path, it creates a "hard coded" link that persists even after removing that link from the menu...
Nah, just coming in from work now. I don't think this has had enough scrutiny yet.
1.19 then, hopefully
Pity
Pity indeed.
...but to be clear @docwilmot were you referring to the layout relationships issue or the update pages one? ...or both?
@quicksketch Need any help with the feature freeze stuff?
I have little time now, but more time in about 2 hours...

@BWPanda I don't think so... the feature freeze items are really the 1.18.0 tag: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/milestone/93 I don't think any of the remaining items are going to make it.

backdrop/backdrop-issues
Issue tracker for Backdrop core. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop-issues development by creating an account on GitHub.
Ok no worries. And not much work to make a new preview release I guess...?
And by local time we only have 40 minutes left :D At least I'll be going to bed soon enough. I will make the 1.18.0-preview release tomorrow.
Yeah the most work is assembling the release notes.

@BWPanda If you want to research ways to automate research notes that would be neat. We use drush rn for bugfix releases (which uses the Git history), but really we could use something that uses the GitHub milestone list instead. Though since there's only 10 items it shouldn't be much work to assemble: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/milestone/93?closed=1

backdrop/backdrop-issues
Issue tracker for Backdrop core. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop-issues development by creating an account on GitHub.
The trouble with drush rn for minor releases is that it includes _all_ the bug fixes from the last 4 months, which for this release would be like 70+ fixes, and only 10 feature issues.
Sure, something for me to work on :smiling_face:

I looked at https://github.com/github-tools/github-release-notes once but I couldn't figure out how it worked :disappointed:

github-tools/github-release-notes
Node module to create a release or a changelog from a tag and uses issues or commits to creating the release notes. - github-tools/github-release-notes
